commit_message:
Add NodeGroup CLI specification

This is one of the specs divided from the orginal NodeGroup spec.
This spec will cover the new CLI APIs and changes to existing APIs
to support the NodeGroup features.

Change-Id: I2833cf2aad9a273d34f77892c700dce04caa23f7
Co-Authored-By: Drago Rosson <drago.rosson@rackspace.com>
Implements: blueprint nodegroups
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum-specs refs/changes/31/425431/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Individual Management of Node Groups ==================================== Launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/nodegroups Heterogeneous container clusters enable interesting use-cases that are impossible on clusters where all nodes are configured the same. For example, workloads that require differing amounts of memory, I/O, or processing power can be placed on the nodes that best fit them. NOTE: Unless specified otherwise, "Cluster" and "ClusterTemplate" refer to the v2 (new) versions. Problem Description =================== The Magnum CLI needs to be updated to support the new NodeGroup features that are described in nodegroups.rst spec. This contains the purposed new APIs and changes to existing APIs to support the features. Proposed Change =============== Add API operations for working with Cluster, NodeGroup, ClusterTemplate, and NodeGroupTemplate **Cluster creation** Clusters can be created in four ways: 1. Specifying all attributes needed to create a cluster It is not necessary to rely on a ClusterTemplate to create a cluster. Instead, all attributes can be sent directly in the request. NodeGroups can be added directly in the same request as well. See clustertemplate-changes.rst spec for details on new Template usage in v2. 2. From a ClusterTemplate If a ClusterTemplate has its attributes sufficiently defined, nothing else is required besides specifying it in the request. The created cluster holds no reference to the ClusterTemplate that it was created from. This allows the original CT to be freely deleted or updated. 3. From another Cluster Specifying another Cluster as the "template" will effectively clone the Cluster's configuration for the new cluster being created. Similar to creating a cluster from a CT, the created cluster holds no reference to the Cluster that it was created from. This allows the original Cluster to be freely deleted or updated. 4. From a Cluster/ClusterTemplate and specifying attributes Attributes can be specified along with a reference to a Cluster/CT. The attributes specified directly in the request will take precedence over the ones in the Cluster/CT. NodeGroups can be added in the same request via attributes and/or referencing NodeGroups/NGTs as well. See REST API Impact for definitions of commands and examples. **ClusterTemplate operations** CRUD operations are valid for ClusterTemplates and work much the same way as they do for Clusters. ClusterTemplates can be created from other CTs and from existing Clusters too. Any NodeGroups from an existing Cluster will be NodeGroupTemplates on the created CT. See REST API Impact for definitions of commands and examples. **NodeGroup operations** See REST API Impact for definitions of commands and examples. **NodeGroupTemplate operations** CRUD operations are valid for NodeGroupTemplates and work much the same way as they do for NodeGroups, except that specifying a ClusterTemplate when creating a NGT is optional. NodeGroupTemplates can be created from other NGTs and from existing NodeGroups too. See REST API Impact for definitions of commands and examples. Design Principles ================= No impact Alternatives ============ None currently suggested REST API Impact =============== This change would lead to a new v2 of the magnum API. The Current API would continue in v1 for legacy support. This would be implemented as a new pecan controller and section within the magnum API service. The magnum python client would also be impacted due to API changes and new commands around the new functionality. The magnum UI would need to be updated. The new APIs and changes to existing APIs make use to the proposed changes found in clustertemplate-changes.rst and cli-positional-arguements.rst specs. Any changes to those proposals prior to approval will be updates in this spec. Cluster operations ------------------ **cluster-create** - Create a Cluster:: magnum cluster-create <cluster definition> Which expands to: magnum cluster-create [Cluster name] \ [--cluster-template <ClusterTemplate name or UUID> ...] \ [--from-cluster <Cluster name or UUID>] \ [--<parameter> <value>] \ [--master-nodegroup <NodeGroup definition> ...] \ [--nodegroup <NodeGroup definition> ...] Examples: Use an existing template: magnum cluster-create k8s-cluster --cluster-template k8s-fedora-template Use an existing template with cluster modifications: magnum cluster-create k8s-cluster \ --cluster-template k8s-fedora-template \ --keypair newkey No template: magnum cluster-create k8s-cluster \ --coe kubernetes \ --external-network public \ --master-nodegroup master-fedora \ --image fedora-atomic-latest \ --nodegroup minion-fedora \ --image fedora-atomic-latest \ --node-count 2 *See the nodegroup-create command for parameters in the NodeGroup definition.* Cluster Name Positional, Optional Default: <Auto-generated name> This specifies the name that will be used for this cluster. If not provided a name will be auto-generated for the cluster. --cluster-template <ClusterTemplate name or UUID> Optional Copies attributes from the specified ClusterTemplate. --cluster-template can be specified multiple times, with attributes from later ClusterTemplates taking precedence. --from-cluster <Cluster name or UUID> Optional Copies attributes from the specified Cluster. --<parameter> <value> If a parameter was not set in any of the ClusterTemplates or existing Clusters that were specified, and there is no default value, the parameter *must* be included. Parameters can also be specified to override defaults or values that would otherwise be taken from any ClusterTemplates or existing Clusters that were specified. All parameters are optional when creating ClusterTemplates. See below for specific parameters. *NOTE: --cluster-template, --from-cluster, and --<parameter> can be specified in any order (e.g. --coe swarm --from-cluster my-cluster --cluster-template my-ct). All of the attributes/parameters will be merged, with later Cluster/CT attributes and parameters taking precedence.* --master-nodegroup <NodeGroup definition> Optional Same as --nodegroup, except the NodeGroup will be a master NodeGroup. The same effect can be achieved by using --nodegroup and specifying --master within the NodeGroup definition. See the nodegroup-create command for parameters in the NodeGroup definition. --nodegroup <NodeGroup definition> Optional Specifies the definition of a NodeGroup to include in the cluster. See the nodegroup-create command for details on its structure. Another --nodegroup parameter will end the current NodeGroup definition. A non-NodeGroup parameter in a NodeGroup definition will result in an error. See the nodegroup-create command for parameters in the NodeGroup definition. *NOTE: Previous iterations of the spec allowed non-NodeGroup parameters to end a NodeGroup definition. There are two reasons this was changed. One, attributes that both Clusters and NodeGroups have (such as keypair) can cause ambiguity. Two, Both clusters and nodegroups have a number of attributes; forcing a user to fix the ordering of flags would still be a better experience than being surprised that an attribute was implicitly treated as a cluster attribute even though it was (mistakenly) intended to be in the nodegroup definition.* Specific Cluster parameters: --coe <coe> No default --keypair <keypair> No default This value will be used for all NodeGroups within the cluster that do not have a NodeGroup keypair set. --external-network <external-network> No default --network-driver <network-driver> Default: <based on coe> --volume-driver <volume-driver> Default: <based on coe> --dns-nameserver <dns-nameserver> Default: '8.8.8.8' --http-proxy <http-proxy> Default: None --https-proxy <https-proxy> Default: None --no-proxy <no-proxy> Default: None --tls-disabled Default: False --registry-enabled Default: False --labels <KEY1=VALUE1;KEY2=VALUE2;KEY3=VALUE3...> Default: None **cluster-update** - Modifies an existing Cluster:: magnum cluster-update <Cluster name or UUID> \ --<Cluster attribute>=<new value> Examples: magnum cluster-update k8s-cluster --name=k8s-cluster-2 Cluster Name or UUID Positional, Mandatory A valid Cluster name/UUID. --<attribute to change>=<new value> Mandatory A valid Cluster attribute that will be updated to a new value. The following attributes can be updated: - name - keypair Attempting to update any other attribute will return an error. **cluster-restart** - Triggers the restart of COE services on each NodeGroup in one or more Clusters:: magnum cluster-restart <Cluster name or UUID> [Cluster name or UUID ...] Example: magnum cluster-restart k8s-cluster magnum cluster-restart k8s-cluster1 k8s-cluster2 Cluster Name or UUID Positional, Mandatory A valid cluster name or UUID. If the Cluster is not valid then an error will be returned. **cluster-delete** - Deletes one or more Clusters and all of their connected NodeGroups:: magnum cluster-delete <Cluster name or UUID ...> Example: magnum cluster-delete k8s-cluster magnum cluster-delete k8s-cluster1 k8s-cluster2 Cluster Name or UUID Positional, Mandatory A valid cluster name or UUID. If it is not valid then an error will be returned. ClusterTemplate operations -------------------------- **cluster-template-create** - Creates a ClusterTemplate:: magnum cluster-template-create [--no-defaults] [--public] \ <Cluster definition> Which expands to: magnum cluster-template-create [--no-defaults] [--public] \ [ClusterTemplate name] \ [--cluster-template <ClusterTemplate name or UUID>] \ [--from-cluster <Cluster name or UUID>] \ [--<parameter> <value> ...] \ [--master-nodegroup <NodeGroup definition> ...] \ [--nodegroup <NodeGroup definition> ...] (Note that all parameters are optional in ClusterTemplates) Example: magnum cluster-template-create k8s-cluster-template \ --coe kubernetes \ --external-network public \ --dns-nameserver 8.8.8.8 \ --network-driver flannel \ --master-nodegroup \ --nodegroup-template k8s-nodegroup-template \ --nodegroup \ --nodegroup-template k8s-nodegroup-template \ --node-count 2 Completely empty cluster template: magnum cluster-template-create --no-defaults my-empty-ct *See the cluster-create command for parameters in the Cluster definition.* *See the nodegroup-create command for parameters in the NodeGroup definition.* --no-defaults Optional Specifies that the created cluster template will not use any default values. The only values set will be those that the user explicitly specified. This makes it easier to create a completely empty/customized template. --public Optional Default: False Makes the ClusterTemplate visible/available to all tenants. **cluster-template-update** - Updates an existing ClusterTemplate:: magnum cluster-template-update <ClusterTemplate name or UUID> \ [--<attribute>=<new value> ...] \ [--clear <attribute> ...] Example: magnum cluster-template-update k8s-cluster-template --keypair=testkey magnum cluster-template-update k8s-cluster-template --clear keypair --clear <attribute> Optional The clear parameter will cause the specified attribute to be set to None. When the template is used to create a Cluster any values set as None will use the attribute defaults in the case of non-mandatory attributes and will generate an error in the case of mandatory ones. **cluster-template-delete** - Deletes one or more existing ClusterTemplates and their attached NodeGroupTemplates:: magnum cluster-template-delete <ClusterTemplate name or UUID> ... Example: magnum cluster-template-delete k8s-cluster-template magnum cluster-template-delete k8s-ct1 k8s-ct2 The definition and usage of the parameters of cluster-template-delete are the same as cluster-delete, except with ClusterTemplate in place of Cluster. NodeGroup operations -------------------- **nodegroup-create** - Creates a NodeGroup and adds it to existing cluster:: magnum nodegroup-create <Cluster name or UUID> <NodeGroup definition> Which expands to: magnum nodegroup-create <Cluster name or UUID> [NodeGroup name] \ [--nodegroup-template <NodeGroupTemplate name or UUID> ...] \ [--from-nodegroup <NodeGroup name or UUID>] \ [--<parameter> <value> ...] Examples: Use an existing template: magnum nodegroup-create k8s-cluster --nodegroup-template k8s-master-template Use an existing template with modifications: magnum nodegroup-create k8s-cluster \ --nodegroup-template k8s-minion-template \ --node-count 5 No template: magnum nodegroup-create k8s-cluster minion-fedora \ --image fedora-atomic-latest \ --flavor m1.small \ --docker-volume-size 5 \ --node-count 1 Cluster Name or UUID Mandatory, Positional A valid Cluster name or UUID must be the first parameter of the create call. If it is missing or the Cluster is not present then an error will be returned. NodeGroup name Optional, Positional Default: <auto-generated> A name for the new NodeGroup. --nodegroup-template <nodegroup-template> Default: None Copies attributes from the specified NodeGroupTemplate. --nodegroup-template can be specified multiple times, with attributes from later NodeGroupTemplates taking precedence. --from-nodegroup <NodeGroup name or UUID> Optional Copies attributes from the specified NodeGroup. --<parameter> <value> If a parameter was not set in any of the NodeGroupTemplates that were specified, and there is no default value, the parameter *must* be included. Parameters can also be specified to override defaults or values that would otherwise be taken from any NodeGroupTemplates that were specified. All parameters are optional when creating NodeGroupTemplates. See below for specific parameters. *NOTE: --nodegroup-template, --from-nodegroup, and --<parameter> can be specified in any order (e.g. --server-type vm --from-nodegroup my-nodegroup --nodegroup-template my-ngt). All of the attributes/parameters will be merged, with later NodeGroup/NGT attributes and parameters taking precedence.* Specific NodeGroup parameters: --master Default: False Specifies the NodeGroup is a master NodeGroup. This will be limited to one NodeGroup within the cluster for initial implementation. If a 2nd NodeGroup with the master flag set is added an error will be generated. --keypair <keypair> No default Specifies a NodeGroup-specific keypair. --server-type <server-type> Default: vm --flavor <flavor> Default: 'm1.small' --node-count <node-count> Default: 1 --image <image> No default --docker-volume-size <docker-volume-size> Default: 25 --docker-storage-driver <docker-storage-driver> Default: 'devicemapper' --labels <KEY1=VALUE1;KEY2=VALUE2;KEY3=VALUE3...> Default: None **nodegroup-update** - Modifies an existing NodeGroup:: magnum nodegroup-update [Cluster name or UUID] <NodeGroup name or UUID> \ [--<attribute> <new value> ...] \ [--clear <attribute> ...] Examples: With Cluster and NodeGroup name: magnum nodegroup-update k8s-cluster k8s-ssd-minion-ng --node-count 3 NodeGroup name only: magnum nodegroup-update k8s-ssd-minion-ng --node-count 1 Cluster Name or UUID Positional, Optional A valid cluster name can be specified to disambiguate which NodeGroup to update. If the Cluster or NodeGroup is not valid, an error will be returned. NodeGroup Name or UUID Positional A valid NodeGroup name or UUID can also be used without a cluster name. If only 1 positional parameter is given it will be taken as the NodeGroup. If multiple NodeGroups exist with the same name then an error will be returned with a message to use the UUID to specify the NodeGroup. --<attribute> <new value> Optional A valid NodeGroup attribute that will be updated to a new value. The following attributes can be updated: - name - node-count - keypair Attempting to update any other attribute will return an error. --clear <attribute> Optional The clear parameter will cause the specified attribute to be unset. This will set the attribute back to the default value in the case of non-mandatory parameters and will fail due with an error on mandatory parameters. **nodegroup-delete** - Deletes a NodeGroup:: magnum nodegroup-delete [Cluster name or UUID] <NodeGroup name or UUID> Examples: magnum nodegroup-delete k8s-cluster k8s-master-ng magnum nodegroup-delete k8s-master-ng Cluster Name or UUID Positional, Optional A valid cluster name can be specified to disambiguate which NodeGroup to update. If the Cluster or NodeGroup is not valid, an error will be returned. NodeGroup Name or UUID Positional, Mandatory A valid NodeGroup name or UUID can also be used without a cluster name. If only 1 positional parameter is given it will be taken as the NodeGroup. If multiple NodeGroups exist with the same name then an error will be returned with a message to use the UUID to specify the NodeGroup. NodeGroupTemplate operations ---------------------------- **nodegroup-template-create** - Creates a NodeGroupTemplate:: magnum nodegroup-template-create [ClusterTemplate name or UUID] \ [--no-defaults] [--public] \ <NodeGroup definition> Which expands to: magnum nodegroup-template-create [ClusterTemplate name or UUID] \ [--no-defaults] [--public] \ [NodeGroupTemplate name] \ [--nodegroup-template <NodeGroupTemplate name or UUID> ...] \ [--from-nodegroup <NodeGroup name or UUID>] \ [--<parameter> <value>] (Note that there are no required parameters in NodeGroupTemplates) Example: magnum nodegroup-template-create k8s-nodegroup-template \ --image fedora-atomic-latest \ --flavor m1.small \ --docker-volume-size 5 \ --node-count 1 *See the nodegroup-create command for parameters in the NodeGroup definition.* ClusterTemplate Name or UUID Positional, Optional If specified, the new NGT will be added to this ClusterTemplate. Otherwise, the NGT will not belong to any ClusterTemplate. --no-defaults Optional Specifies that the created NodeGroupTemplate will not use any default values. The only values set will be those that the user explicitly specified. This makes it easier to create a completely empty/customized template. --public Optional Default: False Makes the NodeGroupTemplate visible/available to all tenants. **nodegroup-template-update** - Updates one or more attributes on an existing NodeGroupTemplate:: magnum nodegroup-template-update [ClusterTemplate name or UUID] \ <NodeGroupTemplate name or UUID> \ [--<attribute>=<new value> ...] \ [--clear <attribute> ...] Example: magnum nodegroup-template-update small-nodegroup-template --keypair=testkey magnum nodegroup-template-update small-nodegroup-template --clear keypair ClusterTemplate Name or UUID Positional, Optional If specified, this will be used to determine which ClusterTemplate to update within the ClusterTemplate. --clear <attribute> Optional The clear parameter will cause the specified attribute to be set to None. When the template is used to create a NodeGroup any values set as None will use the attribute defaults in the case of non-mandatory attributes and will generate an error in the case of mandatory ones. **nodegroup-template-delete** - Deletes one or more existing NodeGroupTemplates:: magnum nodegroup-template-delete [ClusterTemplate name or UUID] \ <NodeGroupTemplate name or UUID> Example: magnum nodegroup-template-delete k8s-ngt magnum nodegroup-template-delete k8s-cluster1 k8s-ngt2 The definition and usage of the parameters of nodegroup-template-delete are the same as nodegroup-delete, except with ClusterTemplate and NodeGroupTemplate in place of Cluster and NodeGroup, respectively. Security Impact =============== A new API version will mean new endpoints and additional testing needed to maintain current security. The expectation is that all changes will meet current security goals and controls. Notifications Impact ==================== Current notifications will remain the same for Clusters. Additional notifications for NodeGroups could be added in a future update if desired. Performance Impact ================== API changes should have minor performance impact. Heat stack changes will need to be tested to verify no major performance impact. Other Deployer Impact ===================== No Impact Developer Impact ================ NodeGroups, v2 API, attribute flattening, template changes, and Heat stack changes will be major changes to Magnum. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- See blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/nodegroups Work Items ---------- See blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/nodegroups Dependencies ============ Testing ======= Existing tests will need to be updated for database, conductor, cluster driver, and v1 api changes. In addition, new tests will need to be added for all v2 APIs. Since existing Clusters will be migrated to a new datamodel, Magnum upgrade testing will also need to be added. Documentation Impact ==================== New API documentation will be added for v2 that will include information on how NodeGroup work. The quickstart guide will also be updated to include usages of the new NodeGroup features. References ==========

commit_message:
Resolve OpenStack Release from dashboard package

As the TrilioVault horizon plugin is not actually OS series
aligned, resolve the OpenStack Release for the deployment
from the openstack-dashboard package.

Change-Id: Ic63cbb8df361417214a1d66efc10b3e7a0e66316

commit_message:
Add doc/requirements.txt to releasenotes tox environment

Without these dependencies, the releasenotes build does not actually
work.

Change-Id: Ic5591a2e5708376e181112315e0702c29c6bd460

subject: Remove six and python 2.7 full support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-20 18:38:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/53be6ba6a963ffb2e9b3bb9aeeddeee9d9fffd33', 'message': "Remove six and python 2.7 full support

Six is in use to help us to keep support for python 2.7.
Since the ussuri cycle we decide to remove the python 2.7
support so we can go ahead and also remove six usage from
the python code.

Review process and help
-----------------------
Removing six introduce a lot of changes and an huge amount of modified files
To simplify reviews we decided to split changes into several patches to avoid
painful reviews and avoid mistakes.

To review this patch you can use the six documentation [1] to obtain help and
understand choices.

Additional informations
-----------------------
Changes related to 'six.b(data)' [2]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

six.b [2] encode the given datas in latin-1 in python3 so I did the same
things in this patch.

Latin-1 is equal to iso-8859-1 [3].

This encoding is the default encoding [4] of certain descriptive HTTP
headers.

I suggest to keep latin-1 for the moment and to move to another encoding
in a follow-up patch if needed to move to most powerful encoding (utf8).

HTML4 support utf8 charset and utf8 is the default charset for HTML5 [5].

Note that this commit message is autogenerated and not necesserly contains
changes related to 'six.b'

[1] https://six.readthedocs.io/
[2] https://six.readthedocs.io/#six.b
[3] https://docs.python.org/3/library/codecs.html#standard-encodings
[4] https://www.w3schools.com/charsets/ref_html_8859.asp
[5] https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_charset.asp

Patch 13 of a serie of 28 patches

Change-Id: I09aa3b7ddd93087c3f92c76c893c609cb9473842

commit_message:
Remove six and python 2.7 full support

Six is in use to help us to keep support for python 2.7.
Since the ussuri cycle we decide to remove the python 2.7
support so we can go ahead and also remove six usage from
the python code.

Review process and help
-----------------------
Removing six introduce a lot of changes and an huge amount of modified files
To simplify reviews we decided to split changes into several patches to avoid
painful reviews and avoid mistakes.

To review this patch you can use the six documentation [1] to obtain help and
understand choices.

Additional informations
-----------------------
Changes related to 'six.b(data)' [2]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

six.b [2] encode the given datas in latin-1 in python3 so I did the same
things in this patch.

Latin-1 is equal to iso-8859-1 [3].

This encoding is the default encoding [4] of certain descriptive HTTP
headers.

I suggest to keep latin-1 for the moment and to move to another encoding
in a follow-up patch if needed to move to most powerful encoding (utf8).

HTML4 support utf8 charset and utf8 is the default charset for HTML5 [5].

Note that this commit message is autogenerated and not necesserly contains
changes related to 'six.b'

[1] https://six.readthedocs.io/
[2] https://six.readthedocs.io/#six.b
[3] https://docs.python.org/3/library/codecs.html#standard-encodings
[4] https://www.w3schools.com/charsets/ref_html_8859.asp
[5] https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_charset.asp

Patch 13 of a serie of 28 patches

Change-Id: I09aa3b7ddd93087c3f92c76c893c609cb9473842

commit_message:
Install rabbitmq for ubuntu from external_repo

While S->T upgrade erlang being upgraded from 20.3 to 22.1 which
requires at least rabbitmq 3.8.0 while we have 3.7.8. So system installs
rabbitmq from distro packages to meet requirements, which eventually
apeears a more modern rabbitmq than we want.
So we pinn package version and install it from external source rather
from file,
as at the erlang upgrade stage repo is already configured and pinned.

Patch also disables upgrade jobs as they still don't catch relevant
commit.

Change-Id: I89019eb91b91b4f868361d575b781616f262171f

commit_message:
[doc] tell to prefix ipv6 hosts with inet6

Some environments with ipv6 used to connect with memcached servers
faced issues by omitting to prefix the host with the address family to
use.

Indeed libraries like python-memcached waiting for a prefix to
initialize the socket with the right address family. If the prefix
isn't given and that the host refer or bind an ipv6 then the socket
is initialized with an address family which correspond to an IPv4
and the connection doesn't work properly.

Openstack's puppet libraries already fixed that by introducing new
feature to automatically prefix the address if needed [1][2].

Anyway it could be worth to add more documentation on oslo.cache
to give more information to customers and avoid similar issues. These
changes aim to provide this documentation.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/q/status:merged+branch:master+topic:memcached-inet6-prefix
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661136/

Change-Id: I5e0b4818300348efe4625500792d9161281ed45a

commit_message:
Remove workflow_engine from client setup

This change removes the workflow engine object from the overcloud deployment
client setup method. This is done to ensure we're not importing and accessing
client objects that are no longer relevant.

Change-Id: Ib7a686732839596ae9b079f8c6e24794ec5d34d7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

openstack-discuss thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014237.html

Bumping l-c:
-openstacksdk to 0.13.0
-Werkzeug to 0.14

Bumping t-r:
-openstacksdk to 0.13.0

Change-Id: I6e7e3792f2cede28ea9098ba546f415cec0ddf9b

commit_message:
[k8s] Fix no IP address in api_address

This is a corner case that when floating_ip_enabled=False,
master_lb_enabled=True,master_lb_floating_ip_enabled=False in
cluster template, but setting floating_ip_enabled=True when
creating the cluster. The current logic is not correct which
resulted in missing IP address in the api_address of cluster.

Task: 39519
Story: 2007586

Change-Id: I5e2ca270c4f4e2c48d067cd5b8f6609c037cb6e5
(cherry picked from commit 5dfb0d94c026a64c774b8363790002cdc15684fc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/49/723749/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | There was a corner case that when floating_ip_enabled=False, master_lb_enabled=True,master_lb_floating_ip_enabled=False in cluster template, but setting floating_ip_enabled=True when creating the cluster, which causes missing IP address in the api_address of cluster. Now the isssue has been fixed.

commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I0bd1180719e4e093a24bc53424052354ad1cd900
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/castellan refs/changes/25/722825/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: Ia3de19ad3bbbb5c85025ed0d9e9dfd872ebe6c9d
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I4a5b1ec999110a50fc904f3ae93e3983efa64f88
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[stable only] Remove timeout in config-download-export

With large number of nodes this can run for more than the
default timeout of 360s as we do fetch the whole config
from heat and generate the playbooks and the workflow can
timeout very easily.

This was removed for config-download worflow with
https://review.opendev.org/620627

Related-Bug: #1805649
Change-Id: Ib413a40a63c9d79e7387f854167d80a105888337

commit_message:
Use in-repo GPG keys

We make remote network hits to get the GPG keys which are quite
unreliable and causes numerous CI failures so this change installs
them from files inside the role.

The implementation here is derived from that which was done in the
galera_server role in I7ac1a5e3a05aa3d0b4fae86c4a325ef147a9a528.

Change-Id: I6d0f11709a1c2ff38a43d4a29565fe63be4a9879

commit_message:
Remove fluentd manifests

We don't need these implementations anymore because fluentd support was
already removed from tripleo-heat-templates.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668851/
Change-Id: If8bca34b9893fc49f598e8c86cd45bc55848363f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/68/721368/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

shared_examples_for 'tripleo::profile::base::logging::fluentd' do before :each do facts.merge!({ :step => params[:step] }) end context 'with step less than 4' do let(:params) { { :step => 3 } } it 'should do nothing' do is_expected.to_not contain_class('fluentd') is_expected.to_not contain_class('systemd::systemctl::daemon_reload') is_expected.to_not contain_fluentd__plugin('rubygem-fluent-plugin-add') end end context 'with defaults and step greater than 3' do let(:params) { { :step => 4 } } it { is_expected.to contain_class('fluentd') } it { is_expected.to contain_class('systemd::systemctl::daemon_reload') } it { is_expected.to contain_fluentd__plugin('rubygem-fluent-plugin-add').with( :plugin_provider => 'yum', ) } it { is_expected.to contain_fluentd__config('110-monitoring-agent.conf') } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/fluentd/config.d/110-monitoring-agent.conf').with_content( "# This file is managed by Puppet, do not edit manually. <source> bind 127.0.0.1 port 24220 @type monitor_agent </source> " ) } it { is_expected.to contain_fluentd__config('110-system-sources.conf') } it { is_expected.to_not contain_file('/etc/rsyslog.d/fluentd.conf') } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/fluentd/config.d/110-system-sources.conf').with_content( "# This file is managed by Puppet, do not edit manually. <source> port 42185 tag system.messages @type syslog </source> " ) } end context 'step greater than 3 and a fluentd source' do let(:params) { { :step => 4, :fluentd_managed_rsyslog => true, :fluentd_sources => [ { 'format' => '/(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/', 'path' => '/var/log/keystone/keystone.log', 'pos_file' => '/var/cache/fluentd/openstack.keystone.pos', 'tag' => 'openstack.keystone', 'type' => 'tail' } ], } } it { is_expected.to contain_class('fluentd') } it { is_expected.to contain_class('systemd::systemctl::daemon_reload') } it { is_expected.to contain_fluentd__plugin('rubygem-fluent-plugin-add').with( :plugin_provider => 'yum', ) } it { is_expected.to contain_fluentd__config('100-openstack-sources.conf').with( :config => { 'source' => params[:fluentd_sources] } ) } it { is_expected.to contain_fluentd__config('110-system-sources.conf') } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/rsyslog.d/fluentd.conf').with_content( "*.* @127.0.0.1:42185" ) } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/fluentd/config.d/100-openstack-sources.conf').with_content( /^\s*path /var/log/keystone/keystone\.log$/ ) } end context 'step greater than 3 and a fluentd source with transformation' do let(:params) { { :step => 4, :fluentd_sources => [ { 'format' => '/(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/', 'path' => '/var/log/keystone/keystone.log', 'pos_file' => '/var/cache/fluentd/openstack.keystone.pos', 'tag' => 'openstack.keystone', 'type' => 'tail' } ], :fluentd_path_transform => [ '/var/log/', '/var/log/containers/', ] } } it { is_expected.to contain_class('fluentd') } it { is_expected.to contain_fluentd__plugin('rubygem-fluent-plugin-add').with( :plugin_provider => 'yum', ) } it { is_expected.to contain_fluentd__config('100-openstack-sources.conf').with( :config => { 'source' => [ { 'format' => '/(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/', 'path' => '/var/log/containers/keystone/keystone.log', 'pos_file' => '/var/cache/fluentd/openstack.keystone.pos', 'tag' => 'openstack.keystone', 'type' => 'tail' } ] } ) } end context 'Config by service -- ceilometer_agent_central' do let(:params) { { :step => 4, :fluentd_default_format => '/(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/', :fluentd_manage_groups => false, :fluentd_pos_file_path => '/var/cache/fluentd/', :service_names => [ 'ceilometer_agent_central' ] } } it { is_expected.to contain_class('fluentd') } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/var/cache/fluentd/') } it { is_expected.to contain_tripleo__profile__base__logging__fluentd__fluentd_service('ceilometer_agent_central').with( :pos_file_path => '/var/cache/fluentd/', :default_format => '/(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/' ) } it { is_expected.to contain_fluentd__config('100-openstack-ceilometer_agent_central.conf') } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/fluentd/config.d/100-openstack-ceilometer_agent_central.conf').with_content( "# This file is managed by Puppet, do not edit manually. <source> format /(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/ path /var/log/ceilometer/central.log pos_file /var/cache/fluentd//openstack.ceilometer.agent.central.pos tag openstack.ceilometer.agent.central @type tail </source> " ) } end context 'Config by service -- ceilometer_agent_central with path trasnformation' do let(:params) { { :step => 4, :fluentd_default_format => '/(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/', :fluentd_manage_groups => false, :fluentd_pos_file_path => '/var/cache/fluentd/', :service_names => [ 'ceilometer_agent_central' ], :fluentd_path_transform => [ '/var/log/', '/var/log/containers/', ] } } it { is_expected.to contain_class('fluentd') } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/var/cache/fluentd/') } it { is_expected.to contain_tripleo__profile__base__logging__fluentd__fluentd_service('ceilometer_agent_central').with( :pos_file_path => '/var/cache/fluentd/', :default_format => '/(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/' ) } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/fluentd/config.d/100-openstack-ceilometer_agent_central.conf').with_content ( "# This file is managed by Puppet, do not edit manually. <source> format /(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/ path /var/log/containers/ceilometer/central.log pos_file /var/cache/fluentd//openstack.ceilometer.agent.central.pos tag openstack.ceilometer.agent.central @type tail </source> " ) } end context 'Multifiles -- horizon' do let(:params) { { :step => 4, :fluentd_default_format => '/(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/', :fluentd_manage_groups => false, :fluentd_pos_file_path => '/var/cache/fluentd/', :service_names => [ 'horizon' ], :fluentd_path_transform => [ '/var/log/', '/var/log/containers/' ] } } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/fluentd/config.d/100-openstack-horizon.conf').with_content ( "# This file is managed by Puppet, do not edit manually. <source> format /(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/ path /var/log/containers/horizon/test.log pos_file /var/cache/fluentd/horizon-test.pos tag openstack.horizon.test @type tail </source> <source> format /(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/ path /var/log/containers/horizon/access.log pos_file /var/cache/fluentd//openstack.horizon.access.pos tag openstack.horizon.access @type tail </source> " ) } end context 'Multifiles -- horizon no transformation' do let(:params) { { :step => 4, :fluentd_default_format => '/(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/', :fluentd_manage_groups => false, :fluentd_pos_file_path => '/var/cache/fluentd/', :service_names => [ 'horizon' ], } } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/fluentd/config.d/100-openstack-horizon.conf').with_content ( "# This file is managed by Puppet, do not edit manually. <source> format /(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/ path /var/log/horizon/test.log pos_file /var/cache/fluentd/horizon-test.pos tag openstack.horizon.test @type tail </source> <source> format /(?<time>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2} =>\d{2}:\d{2}.\d+) (?<pid>\d+) (?<priority>\S+) (?<message>.*)$/ path /var/log/horizon/access.log pos_file /var/cache/fluentd//openstack.horizon.access.pos tag openstack.horizon.access @type tail </source> " ) } end context 'Groups by service -- ceilometer_agent_central added ceilometer' do let(:params) { { :step => 4, :fluentd_manage_groups => true, :fluentd_groups => [ 'fluentd' ] } } it { is_expected.to contain_class('fluentd') } it { is_expected.to contain_user('fluentd').with( :ensure =>'present', :groups => [ 'fluentd', 'ceilometer', 'horizon' ], :membership => 'minimum' ) } end context 'fluentd user and managed groups' do let(:params) { { :step => 4, :fluentd_service_user => 'fluentd', :fluentd_manage_groups => true, :fluentd_groups => [ 'fluentd' ] } } it { is_expected.to contain_class('fluentd') } it { is_expected.to contain_class('systemd::systemctl::daemon_reload') } it { is_expected.to contain_service('fluentd') } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/systemd/system/fluentd.service.d/fluentd_user.conf') .with( { :ensure => 'file', :content => [ "# This file is maintained by puppet.
[Service]
User=fluentd
" ] } ) } it { is_expected.to contain_user('fluentd').with( :ensure =>'present', :groups => [ 'fluentd','ceilometer','horizon' ], :membership => 'minimum' ) } end context 'root user, no matter about groups' do let(:params) { { :step => 4, :fluentd_service_user => 'root', :fluentd_manage_groups => true, :fluentd_groups => [ 'fluentd' ] } } it { is_expected.to contain_class('fluentd') } it { is_expected.to contain_class('systemd::systemctl::daemon_reload') } it { is_expected.to contain_service('fluentd') } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/systemd/system/fluentd.service.d/fluentd_user.conf') .with( { :ensure => 'file', :content => [ "# This file is maintained by puppet.
[Service]
User=root
" ] } ) } it { is_expected.to_not contain_user('fluentd') } end end on_supported_os.each do |os, facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) { facts } it_behaves_like 'tripleo::profile::base::logging::fluentd' end end end

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-27 11:45:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_tempest_plugin/api/admin/test_external_network_extension.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/commit/03700aa12b4e22552f8626ffb9d5261d7a7c44c8', 'message': "Ensure that external network don't have any ports before deletion

In module
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.admin.test_external_network_extension
we need to ensure that there is no any leftover ports, like e.g.

Change-Id: I8226e999d9ec8e521b39ab915aaa503425174987

commit_message:
Ensure that external network don't have any ports before deletion

In module
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.admin.test_external_network_extension
we need to ensure that there is no any leftover ports, like e.g.
floatingip_agent_gateway port before network deletion.

Closes-bug: #1875344

Change-Id: I8226e999d9ec8e521b39ab915aaa503425174987
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin refs/changes/87/723387/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.addCleanup(self._delete_network, network['id']) def _delete_network(self, net_id): try: self.admin_client.delete_network(net_id) except lib_exc.Conflict: ports = self.admin_client.list_ports(network_id=net_id)['ports'] for port in ports: self.admin_client.delete_port(port['id']) self.admin_client.delete_network(net_id)

commit_message:
Remove deprecated nova::metadata::enable_proxy_headers_parsing

The nova::metadata::enable_proxy_headers_parsing parameter was
deprecated in puppet-nova[1], and is useless now because we set
nova::api::enable_proxy_headers_parsing already.

[1] 7c1717af69d2659703833e9fefe9af86664d2e29

Change-Id: I6f51af926ae1f20a5362e4cf5121ee9e1b88693c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/96/723096/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[ci] Use magnum-tempest-plugin-tests-api

This commit drops magnum-functional-api (which uses legacy-dsvm-base due
to be removed in the V cycle) in favour of
magnum-tempest-plugin-tests-api defined in the magnum-tempest-plugins
repo (which uses the new devstack-tempest job recommended for running
Tempest tests in Zuul v3) for API Tempest tests.

Story: 2007561
Task: 39443

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/721077/

Change-Id: I91446f8773ecec1286c9913c3fff688bd8d9a087

commit_message:
[Q->T] Alow supplying command options to leapp

Leapp now allows providing custom repos for upgrade. To use this one
has to provide "--enablerepo <reponame 1> --enablerepo <reponame 2>".

Change-Id: I23696700688042408005b2a6556a854ec523e8d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/85/720685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: UpgradeLeappCommandOptions: description: | In case or using UpgradeLeappDevelSkip with LEAPP_NO_RHSM=1 user can specify --enablerepo <repo1> --enablerepo <repo2> options for leapp to use these repositories for the upgrade process. type: string default: '' upgrade_leapp_command_options: {get_param: UpgradeLeappCommandOptions} {% if upgrade_leapp_command_options|default(false) %}{{ upgrade_leapp_command_options }}{% endif %}

commit_message:
Enable focal and ussuri for the charm

The charm requires a bundle force override for the focal bundle.  This
patch adds test bundles for bionic-ussuri and focal-ussuri to the charm.

Change-Id: I6e6cbb30fe7b525a49b7c79181b5aaeb2e129cca

commit_message:
[ci] Define/enable magnum-tempest-plugin-tests-api

This commit defines magnum-tempest-plugin-tests-api job which uses the
new devstack-tempest as parent job recommended for running
Tempest tests in Zuul v3.

Story: 2007561
Task: 39470

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/721265

Change-Id: If7b77099a90d405e248c80777fa5e8b3612b5c2e

commit_message:
Improve test coverage

Added a number of unit tests based on coverage report
data, it's up to 79% now.

Fixed test_pool_create_exception() to call pool_create()
instead of pool_update().

Also fixed a bug in the driver.pool_update() exception code
path found when adding a new test, status['pools'] is the
correct element.

Change-Id: Ic72aad21e0ecf5b0334b321b18515d909daa3ba4
(cherry picked from commit eb1e24ac46f458887a31ffde54342ec2e34345f7)

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I20344db2a6d89fdc4e97a3dc03a76bff61a41b14

commit_message:
doc: update how to run specific test in pytest

pytest has a different way to run specific test from django test runner.
pytest migration patch did not update our document.
This commit is a follow-up patch.

Change-Id: Ifed388928f159a5a602088b2cfbf7f601d044387
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/07/723307/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I2bb5204c1ee88d0b0cd6df830dac80d37bfddcf2
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine,
  move constraints into deps

Change-Id: I21589f52dd5f888a3a93ae89857293466cf11695

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I9cf36db9e18d02238ebbfa6962f0ac76d694a43a

commit_message:
Fixed capability discovery endpoint hardcode

It fixes get_capabilities() method to process
correctly endpoints like: 'https://<ip>:<port>/v1',
'https://<ip>:<port>/swift/v1'.

Co-Authored-By: Daniel Cech <dcech@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ib4037d0b49da1bce959947100629370805f510d5
Closes-bug: #1712358

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iadf66b784540b8ee7393841792a11fe6e3416cfa

commit_message:
Update for Python 3

This repo is now Python 3 only, make a few updates:
* Move basepython to testenv
* Require newer tox version and ignore base conflicts
* update openstackdocstheme and sphinx versions
* Use newer TOX_x for constraints

Fix mysql driver comparison operator

A test was failing due to L67 in tooz/drivers/mysql.py using `is`
instead of `==`.

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not needed
for installation.

Change-Id: I7dd7a16d2b2d75120fa14de1d5c080a1a1c9729d

commit_message:
Move unit tests execution to stestr

From time to time, unit tests execution fails with error: "TypeError:
'NoneType' object is not iterable". It seems that problem is in
unittest2 library, which is used by testtools for executing the tests.
Stestr lib is usinig unittest by default and the problem does not appear
for several hundred launches.

Authored-By: danpawlik <dpawlik@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I6646629128d9265b5fb7390dc131c55cf34a07ca
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Re-validate healthcheck work on nova/keystone containers

They were disabled until the native podman healthcheck was integrated in
tripleo-ansible and it finally merged; so we can remove that safeguard
and it should be working.

Change-Id: I03361c33e54f0c8e71b420b144464ccb29a1ca4e

commit_message:
Set Neutron's l3_ha flag to True in standalone ML2/OVS job

Even if this is standalone job, when l3_ha config option is set
to True in Neutron server, all routers will be created as HA
routers.
So for each such router created during the tests things like
keepalived, neutron-keepalived-state-change-monitor will be spawned
and also HA network will be created for tenants used by Tempest.
This will give us better coverage of things which are most commonly
used in Neutron.

Change-Id: I44ed60e88723e58ff1bb7bd0559540a596442f5a
(cherry picked from commit c53f747b1a96e696a44d6962e7624f49640e6a61)

commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

openstack-discuss thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014237.html

Bumping pbr since oslo.log requires 3.1.1

Change-Id: I1f968c724e79e04bbc2fe8cb26fd54404b0350e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-prometheus-exporter refs/changes/93/720793/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Upgrade centos in dockerfiles

Somehow an update to centos repos and the fact that docker.io centos
containers weren't updated for a while broke us. To fix this we need to
make sure RPMs in the container are upgraded, otherwise `yum history
undo last` fails miserably with missing packages errors.

Also this commit makes sure installation dies when we're unable to build
containers.

Change-Id: I29e19e13aa22047bfa07817a7794fc18612bbc32

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

This also adds the standard expected jobs to be run for ussuri.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Various fixes to make the expected jobs pass as well.

Change-Id: I3e8c107c9e3cb8a13a531fb81fd2030d0aad0e7e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Remove unncessary "=="

Change-Id: I1d321e17470216b76fca84f21896bc1457a6a92a

commit_message:
Update verbosity so it is consistently set

This change will set the verbosity consistently whenever a playbook is
executed via the client.

All tests have been updated to ensure that the verbosity setting is always
defined when a playbook is executed.

Change-Id: I35b10d48344c8b7f71186bc529a300f75d7b8d63
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

revisions:

adds a --enable-registry-login flag to `openstack container image
prepare default` that can be used to ensure the

Change-Id: I809023604fe119ba162638d921ffec56d4eb72f2

commit_message:
Add login flag to container image prepare defaults

If a registry requires authentication and --local-push-destination is
not used, a user may need to enable the login functionality. This change
adds a --enable-registry-login flag to `openstack container image
prepare default` that can be used to ensure the
ContainerImageRegistryLogin flag is defined as true.  Previously this
would have needed to be added in elsewhere.

Change-Id: I809023604fe119ba162638d921ffec56d4eb72f2
(cherry picked from commit c08c5c2b9299f47a0f1c8103b5ccafae1cf2b766)

added_lines: def test_prepare_default_registyr_login(self): temp = tempfile.mkdtemp() self.addCleanup(shutil.rmtree, temp) env_file = os.path.join(temp, 'containers_env.yaml') arglist = ['--enable-registry-login', '--output-env-file', env_file] verifylist = [] self.app.command_options = [ 'tripleo', 'container', 'image', 'prepare', 'default' ] + arglist cmd = container_image.TripleOImagePrepareDefault(self.app, None) parsed_args = self.check_parser(cmd, arglist, verifylist) cmd.take_action(parsed_args) with open(env_file) as f: result = yaml.safe_load(f) self.assertEqual( True, result['parameter_defaults']['ContainerImageRegistryLogin'] )

commit_message:
Avoid raising NetworkInterfaceNotFound exception in DHCP agent logs

In "ip_lib.ensure_device_is_ready", before retrieving the interface
attributes, a check is done to know if the interface exists. In case
it does not exist, the exception "NetworkInterfaceNotFound" will not
be raised and written in the logs.

Conflicts:
    neutron/privileged/agent/linux/ip_lib.py

Change-Id: I4b9fd0885d850601717274a5058e042871211bbb
Closes-Bug: #1854723
(cherry picked from commit 8cc2765b5fdd229c9f6f19b83ad9e1ba030040ae)
(cherry picked from commit afd6b2f5aed86da2cc4b2e4b41a69d1197600089)

added_lines: from oslo_log import log as loggingLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def get_link_id(device, namespace, raise_exception=True): with get_iproute(namespace) as ip: link_id = ip.link_lookup(ifname=device) if not link_id or len(link_id) < 1: if raise_exception: raise NetworkInterfaceNotFound(device=device, namespace=namespace) else: LOG.debug('Interface %(dev)s not found in namespace %(namespace)s', {'dev': device, 'namespace': namespace}) return None return link_id[0] idx = get_link_id(ifname, namespace, raise_exception=False)
deleted_lines: def get_link_id(device, namespace): try: with get_iproute(namespace) as ip: return ip.link_lookup(ifname=device)[0] except IndexError: raise NetworkInterfaceNotFound(device=device, namespace=namespace) idx = get_link_id(ifname, namespace) except NetworkInterfaceNotFound: return False

commit_message:
Forwards LOGOUT_URL to templates.

Uses the openstack context preprocessor to pass
the LOGOUT_URL from settings to templates and
changes the 'Sign out' menu entry to redirect to it
instead of the logout view directly.

closes-bug: #1747149
Change-Id: Id17ffca6b5e24779433c3f19d009bb2a77f7b901
(cherry picked from commit a11aa7ff62c15d7bf15367106f933ef0ae5d4521)

commit_message:
Fix spurious test failure

idlutils.wait_for_change can be called several times depending on
what happens w/ the thread starting. Just test that it is called at
least one time with the correct arguments.

Change-Id: I04a4a8ce44212055b08dbfc187d120a7f764e1d1

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifc071a43dea09793b19d97980c29731b58831b91

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I53dec0921834c4b30d0ec9430a810a785ef49831

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Icbe925dfce9eaf9c3285d97fd75a8e5926e7ca08

commit_message:
Move /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts bind mount where it's needed

There is no need to bind mount /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts for all the
containers. It's only useful for nova_compute and nova_libvirt
containers where live migration needs that file to work.

Change-Id: I9765dedf43d2c6765922eafaa9d5791ce488b41f
(cherry picked from commit d1bf6c6f21a1267171450feee4178e90b104cae3)

commit_message:
Improve VLAN allocations synchronization

In order to reduce the number of elements retrieved from the DB, this
patch, before processing the VLAN allocations per physical network,
deleted those registers belonging to any unconfigured physical network.

The VLAN registers per physical network are deleted using a bulk delete
operation, to speed up the process.

Those missing VLAN registers per network are now created using a bulk
insert operation, available in the ORM. This bulk operation speeds up
the sync process.

Conflicts:
      neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/type_vlan.py

Change-Id: I8568e2277e157754aaff87a059a40e34e6a43e2b
Partial-Bug: #1862178
(cherry picked from commit 016e7826f165e69c3956375fc3aa8b8d642c9dc9)
(cherry picked from commit 651eb12bec5e5e986bed79f3a5c006c617e79bda)
(cherry picked from commit 4fff732b76ee5d9a4917901b33ce80ccafb5203f)
(cherry picked from commit 8a6521e4457acbd7ceed941f363ee7c9872422ba)

added_lines: @staticmethod def get_physical_networks(context): query = context.session.query(VlanAllocation.db_model.physical_network) query = query.group_by(VlanAllocation.db_model.physical_network) physnets = query.all() return {physnet.physical_network for physnet in physnets} @staticmethod def delete_physical_networks(context, physical_networks): column = VlanAllocation.db_model.physical_network context.session.query(VlanAllocation.db_model).filter( column.in_(physical_networks)).delete(synchronize_session=False) @staticmethod def bulk_create(ctx, physical_network, vlan_ids): ctx.session.bulk_insert_mappings( vlan_alloc_model.VlanAllocation, [{'physical_network': physical_network, 'allocated': False, 'vlan_id': vlan_id} for vlan_id in vlan_ids])

subject: Remove healthcheck from ceilometer_gnocchi_upgrade container
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-28 14:27:56.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/ceilometer/ceilometer-agent-central-container-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/7d2aac5264071bcca807fbd02dd26ae01aaeb294', 'message': "Remove healthcheck from ceilometer_gnocchi_upgrade container

Not sure why ceilometer_gnocchi_upgrade has healthcheck key in its
configuration but the container isn't managed by systemd and it's only
running a one-off shell command to upgrade ceilometer so it should not
have a healthcheck.

Change-Id: I38aa38099a2d759c1b1f2e14d64c36d52c0b1c0e
Related-Bug: #1873249
(cherry picked from commit d78ce138f67aee2f2bf9c5d0db89a5b1e4b16fb0)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove healthcheck from ceilometer_gnocchi_upgrade container

Not sure why ceilometer_gnocchi_upgrade has healthcheck key in its
configuration but the container isn't managed by systemd and it's only
running a one-off shell command to upgrade ceilometer so it should not
have a healthcheck.

Change-Id: I38aa38099a2d759c1b1f2e14d64c36d52c0b1c0e
Related-Bug: #1873249
(cherry picked from commit d78ce138f67aee2f2bf9c5d0db89a5b1e4b16fb0)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8b4da34ace670820d19a35e21f183c6fdac6595b

commit_message:
Make sure octavia uses internal endpoint to barbican

The octavia service communicates to the barbican service with
public endpoint_type by default[1], it should use internal
like other services.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/0056b5175f89070164849501ec6d960549b95e34/octavia/common/config.py#L533-L537

Closes-Bug: #1875618
Change-Id: I90d2b0aeac090a3e2366341e260232fc1f0d6492
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/88/723788/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | Switch endpoint_type from publicURL to internalURL for octavia communicating with the barbican service.

commit_message:
Don't use neutron dns search domain

If there is a neutron search domain available don't use
it since we use the Juju provider dns for the o-hm0 port.

Change-Id: I369d7708f7149e7b491c0f4a1f86126cb0707373
Related-Bug: #1845303

commit_message:
[Unity] Support create volume with tiering policy.

four supported values:
  - ``StartHighThenAuto``(default)
  - ``Auto``
  - ``HighestAvailable``
  - ``LowestAvailable``

Change-Id: I571cec8139b645f0899428ccd4479a2e11bb92d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/21/668621/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Create volume with tiering policy.Storage tiering support ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Unity supports fully automated storage tiering which requires the FAST license activated on the Unity. The OpenStack administrator can use the extra spec key ``storagetype:tiering`` to set the tiering policy of a volume and use the key ``fast_support='<is> True'`` to let Block Storage scheduler find a volume back end which manages a Unity with FAST license activated. There are the four supported values for the extra spec key ``storagetype:tiering`` when creating volume. - Key: ``storagetype:tiering`` - Possible values: - ``StartHighThenAuto`` - ``Auto`` - ``HighestAvailable`` - ``LowestAvailable`` - Default: ``StartHighThenAuto`` Run the following commands to create a volume type with tiering policy: .. code-block:: console $ openstack volume type create ThinVolumeOnAutoTier $ openstack volume type set --property provisioning:type=thin --property storagetype:tiering=Auto --property fast_support='<is> True' ThinVolumeOnAutoTier .. note:: The tiering policy cannot be applied to a deduplicated volume. Tiering policy of the deduplicated LUN align with the settings of the pool.

continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Pin neutron-tempest-plugin to 0.9.0 for Train branch.

This is the last version of the neutron plugin which supports py2.7
Also disable upgrade jobs to resolve conflict

commit_message:
CI: Fix Debian aarch64 jobs

Debian defaults to Python2 which is not complete in aarch64 images.
This patch changes CI to always use Python3.

We need to install several Python modules to have working ussuri jobs.

"Failed to import the required Python library (setuptools) on primary's Python /usr/bin/python3."

And then several Python2 ones for train->ussuri upgrade jobs:

"Unable to find any of pip2 to use. pip needs to be installed."

Change-Id: Ia0d3ff15d97d1cabbb0b8e7f32e8712ca3f94732

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Remove explicit listed jobs from check queue, they are in the templates.

- Update jobs
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
  * Some other sections are obsolete
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>
Change-Id: I4a1976c78b0fe69cc1b423c516d557838cb6d59b

commit_message:
Move stable branch gate job to stable/ussuri

We have stable/ussuri branch as latest stable and
d-g test only latest stable branch to make sure the compatibility
of legacy jobs.

This commit moves the legacy stable job testing to stable/ussuri.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/723605/
Change-Id: Id57e5590a5b24c2d821381f52e1c445cbbd1105b

commit_message:
[stable-only] Raise error for temp_ssh_key import failure

We should not be ignoring the error as we would skip the
admin-enablement workflow and running ansible playbooks would
fail later.

Change-Id: I69c79b3bfec4467210ca6c480f61e14cbf1d0a44
Partial-Bug: #1873892

commit_message:
[Storwize] Add an option to specify iSCSI IP version

Spectrum Virtualize Family Cinder driver support bot IPv4 and IPv6
address for iSCSI Connection. In some scenario, especially test
environment, server has both IPv4 and IPv6 address configured, but User
want to select specific IP version for iSCSI connection. This patch
aim to resolve this kind of issue.

Co-Author: lixqin@cn.ibm.com

Change-Id: Ief8304ded53e8e10b366d698282bb976d65fdc59
Closes-Bug: #1855717
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/30/698630/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Add an config option allow user to specify which IP version Storwize cinder driver should use to establish iSCSI connection.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id71622da0b30fda1aa1f223dffc10e4e3b08f370

subject: Workaround in NetworkSegmentRange OVO until "project_id" migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-24 10:34:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_network_segment_range.py', 'neutron/objects/network_segment_range.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/995018d7540bb4fdb47acf42cac554da40a5954c', 'message': 'Workaround in NetworkSegmentRange OVO until "project_id" migration

The "network_segment_range" service plugin API does not have
"tenant_id" as parameter. However, because the migration from
"tenant_id" to "project_id" did not finish, every OVO with
"project_id" will also have "tenant_id" as an extra field. This
extra field will be populated with the same value as the
"project_id" field.

If the Neutron API WSGI is used and "tenant_id" is not present in
the API (defined in neutron-lib), both "tenant_id" and "project_id"
parameters will be removed from the response.

This patch introduces a workaround for this OVO until the migration
is over.

More information about this patch can be found in the bug c#4.

Change-Id: I85a02d8b59e8a758826c110e00df84672fa93676
Closes-Bug: #1828205
(cherry picked from commit 3053caaa02adaadfffa53fb1070aaa60f49419e8)
(cherry picked from commit c945e5ccbadf35d1422828f654a960caf2cd979c)
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround in NetworkSegmentRange OVO until "project_id" migration

The "network_segment_range" service plugin API does not have
"tenant_id" as parameter. However, because the migration from
"tenant_id" to "project_id" did not finish, every OVO with
"project_id" will also have "tenant_id" as an extra field. This
extra field will be populated with the same value as the
"project_id" field.

If the Neutron API WSGI is used and "tenant_id" is not present in
the API (defined in neutron-lib), both "tenant_id" and "project_id"
parameters will be removed from the response.

This patch introduces a workaround for this OVO until the migration
is over.

More information about this patch can be found in the bug c#4.

Change-Id: I85a02d8b59e8a758826c110e00df84672fa93676
Closes-Bug: #1828205
(cherry picked from commit 3053caaa02adaadfffa53fb1070aaa60f49419e8)
(cherry picked from commit c945e5ccbadf35d1422828f654a960caf2cd979c)

subject: Set a default IP route metric in ip_lib.list_ip_routes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-23 15:45:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/test_linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f900561550966b0d76936a292f658e16a97c1c00', 'message': 'Set a default IP route metric in ip_lib.list_ip_routes

By default, if no metric is defined, the kernel interprets the
highest value (0).

The current implementation, using pyroute2, is a translation from
the CLI command "ip route". This command uses the netlink API to
communicate with the kernel. In IPv6, when the metric value is not
set is translated as 1024 as default [1].

[1]https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3659171

Change-Id: I0c5f9e320bbbf314a2d6a22c515bf903de84cdaf
Related-Bug: #1855759
(cherry picked from commit 7593f95a741aec62d9956175ce6d3ce1b1abb9a0)
'}]
commit_message:
Set a default IP route metric in ip_lib.list_ip_routes

By default, if no metric is defined, the kernel interprets the
highest value (0).

The current implementation, using pyroute2, is a translation from
the CLI command "ip route". This command uses the netlink API to
communicate with the kernel. In IPv6, when the metric value is not
set is translated as 1024 as default [1].

[1]https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3659171

Change-Id: I0c5f9e320bbbf314a2d6a22c515bf903de84cdaf
Related-Bug: #1855759
(cherry picked from commit 7593f95a741aec62d9956175ce6d3ce1b1abb9a0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/84/722384/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE: no metric is interpreted by the kernel as having the highest priority # (value 0). "ip route" uses the netlink API to communicate with the kernel. In # IPv6, when the metric value is not set is translated as 1024 as default: # https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3659171 IP_ROUTE_METRIC_DEFAULT = {constants.IP_VERSION_4: 0, constants.IP_VERSION_6: 1024} metric = (get_attr(route, 'RTA_PRIORITY') or IP_ROUTE_METRIC_DEFAULT[ip_version]) 'metric': metric,

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie1009a0048c697f5290f9ea202fe144b4064edb0

commit_message:
Refactor ansible inventory generation

- Removes the incorrect swift_url lookup
- Removes the usage of session object
- Removes os_auth_token for undercloud
- Moves the code to inventory module for it to be used in ansible
module

Change-Id: I3cdce51764a27a389e008832ed366b6346c4f0e0

commit_message:
Add login flag to container image prepare defaults

If a registry requires authentication and --local-push-destination is
not used, a user may need to enable the login functionality. This change
adds a --enable-registry-login flag to `openstack container image
prepare default` that can be used to ensure the
ContainerImageRegistryLogin flag is defined as true.  Previously this
would have needed to be added in elsewhere.

Change-Id: I809023604fe119ba162638d921ffec56d4eb72f2

added_lines: def test_prepare_default_registyr_login(self): temp = tempfile.mkdtemp() self.addCleanup(shutil.rmtree, temp) env_file = os.path.join(temp, 'containers_env.yaml') arglist = ['--enable-registry-login', '--output-env-file', env_file] verifylist = [] self.app.command_options = [ 'tripleo', 'container', 'image', 'prepare', 'default' ] + arglist cmd = container_image.TripleOImagePrepareDefault(self.app, None) parsed_args = self.check_parser(cmd, arglist, verifylist) cmd.take_action(parsed_args) with open(env_file) as f: result = yaml.safe_load(f) self.assertEqual( True, result['parameter_defaults']['ContainerImageRegistryLogin'] )

commit_message:
DNM - build tripleo images on top of ubi8 instead of centos8

This is just for testing, no need to review it.
I'm looking if 1) the image build find and 2) compare their size with
the centos8 images.

Change-Id: I7f03aa9b2bbe3267ed91be0cd0283a99bed4fd88

commit_message:
Split out selinux management

Currently if you have selinux enabled on the undercloud but disable it
for the overcloud, selinux is disabled on the undercloud during the
deployment. This can be resolved by only managing the selinux setting
for the deployment target hosts rather than the all.

Change-Id: I94b81ea0b954cdba7704720a145b752fa58d4308
Closes-Bug: #1874828

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] drop python 2.7 support

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle except
swift and sorlets which is exception approved in this goal.

Somehow this repo is left to remove the support of py2.7.

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I0b8a896ce64a4b31c11444a2af45ae503ad089f1

zuul: Switch to the Zuulv3 grenade job

newly introduced Zuulv3 based grenade job.

commit_message:
Support for PowerMax Volume Config

PowerMax config options have changed since newton.
Updating them to the latest. Supports both iSCSI and FC
drivers.

Supports deploying multiple instances of the
cinder::backend::dellemc_powermax backend
(e.g. one iscsi + one fc, multiple iscsi, etc.).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708960/
Change-Id: I25be51121390afd7ed3d0f0249733d3ccaf557de

commit_message:
Focal enablement

Added support for charm to install py3 packages

Fixed gss script to run on both py2 and py3

Added the ability for the script wrapper to get the distro version
so the gss script can be launched with the right python binary.

focal-ussuri test bundle added and smoke/dev tests changed to focal-ussuri

charmhelpers sync

-----
LP related bug: #1853456

Change-Id: I161d8a0fa9787f0d5409f7bf386c22d98aae0a64

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-26 16:39:47.000000000', 'files': ['roles/setup-devstack-source-dirs/defaults/main.yaml', 'roles/setup-devstack-source-dirs/tasks/main.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/332992ace2bcb2a4d94c0ae3ccbc7c3a2a7bcb38', 'message': 'setup-devstack-source-dirs: add var for paths

'}]
commit_message:
setup-devstack-source-dirs: add var for paths

The paths for the devstack source directories are currently hardcoded,
this patch allows overriding that list.

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python
3, so let's make a few cleanups:
- Remove setup.* files, they are not needed
  for this repo
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now
  obsolete content.
- Remove install_command, the default is fine;
  move constraints into deps

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/720558
Change-Id: Ic6ea57d750a203b5a8f199b78dd3c0889b849df9

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/720558
Change-Id: I4994a888c81ad414a95ea4186638ad27a8bb3c71

commit_message:
Remove redundant listen on haproxy handler

Follow-up on [1] "Avoid multiple haproxy restarts after
reconfiguration".

There is no need to duplicate handler name in listen.
The issue was because we had two handlers with the same
name in the same environment.
This causes Ansible not to mark handler as already run.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/708385

Change-Id: I5425a8037b6860ef71bce59becff8dfe5b601d4c
Related-Bug: #1864810
(cherry picked from commit 98e86ea62b64eb1c5a7dfaca6c366527f584afc0)

drop tripleo-common-tempest-plugin

while we have Py2 for CentOS 7.

revisions:

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Remove hacking requirements from lower-constraints, they
